intro: Calceolaria chrysosphaera, commonly known as the golden cup-cress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small cups, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. Calceolaria chrysosphaera is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique blooms.
